definition: uncle (polite form of address for older male)

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
father's elder brother/senior/paternal elder uncle/eldest of brothers/respectful form of address/Count, third of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]
grandpa (polite form of address for old man)

sentences.english: You 'd better ask that old man himself.
sentences.chinese: 你最好問問那老伯伯本人。

sentences.english: The first welcome I got as I came out of the airport terminal building was a bear hug from Old Man Winter.
sentences.chinese: 剛走出候機樓，首先歡迎我的就是冬天老伯的熊抱。

sentences.english: That old uncle of yours is a queer fish.
sentences.chinese: 你那位老伯伯，可真是個古怪的人。

sentences.english: Look, the old man's kite is a dragon.
sentences.chinese: 看，那位老伯伯的是一隻巨龍風箏。

sentences.english: You set a good example for us when you helped the old man cross the street.
sentences.chinese: 你幫助那名老伯伯過馬路，爲我們樹立了好榜樣。

sentences.english: Whose grave are you digging, old men?
sentences.chinese: 老伯，你們正在挖誰的墓穴呢？

sentences.english: Excuse me, pop. Can I ask you something?
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉，老伯，可以問你點事情嗎？

sentences.english: Williams will receive an honorary doctorate in humane letters.
sentences.chinese: 威廉老伯將被授與人文學榮譽博士。

definition: grandpa (polite form of address for old man)
(coll.) father's older brother/uncle/term of respect for older man
(old) grandfather/polite address for an elderly man, or a woman's father-in-law/(Taiwanese) grandfather
(of an elderly couple) husband or wife
old man or woman/the elderly/one's aged parents or grandparents
(coll.) father's father's mother/paternal great-grandmother/respectful form of address for an old woman
old man/I (an old man referring to himself)
